PppDataConn::PppDataConn (  const DataConnProfilePtr &  profile  )  [protected]
 

Creates a PPP data connection which uses profile on setup. The given profile smart pointer must be valid, otherwise an assertion holds.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN PppDataConn::CancelSetup (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

This method is called when a data connection shall be canceled during the setup phase. Derived classes can override this method to immediately stop the setup process. This is especially needed if the setup process might take a long time. If this method is not overridden then the data connection continues the setup process completely but then immediately shuts it down again since a cancel request was issued during the setup process.

Returns:
Tells if the cancellation was done.

Reimplemented from DataConn.

void PppDataConn::Cleanup (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Cleans up the internals to virginal state.

Reimplemented from DataConn.

Reimplemented in CsdDataConn.

Asynchronous data connection release request.

virtual void PppDataConn::DoSetup (   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Asynchronous data connection setup request.

Implements DataConn.

void PppDataConn::DoStartPppRelease (   )  [protected]
 

Starts the PPP release process. On successful start the release process proceeds, otherwise the base state machine receives the external event that the setup failed.

void PppDataConn::DoStartPppSetup (   )  [protected]
 

Starts the PPP setup process. On successful start the setup process proceeds, otherwise the base state machine receives the external event that the setup failed.

BOOLEAN PppDataConn::GetIpAddress (  IpAddr &  addr  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Retrieves the IP address that is currently assigned to this PPP data connection. If the PPP connection is currently not up and running and hence no address can be retrieved then FALSE will be returned.

Implements DataConn.

virtual void PppDataConn::OnAfterPppRelease (   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Give derived class the chance to do something after PPP has been released (regardless of setup success or failure). The override must finally call ReleasedEvent(), otherwise we end up in a deadlock.

Reimplemented in CsdDataConn.

virtual void PppDataConn::OnBeforePppSetup (   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Give derived class the chance to do something before PPP setup starts. If the override succeeds with its task, then it must finally call DoStartPppSetup(); if the override fails with its task, then it has to call SetupFailedEvent(). If neither is called, we end up in a deadlock.

Reimplemented in CsdDataConn.

void PppDataConn::OnPppSetup (  INT  error,
const PppSetupCallBackData *  data
)  [protected]
 

Method called by PppSetupCallbackHandler() to react when the PPP setup process is finished. Depending on the success of the PPP setup, the base state machine receives the respective external event.

void PppDataConn::OnPppStop (  INT  error  )  [protected]
 

Method called by PppStopCallbackHandler() to react when the PPP connection is stopped.
